alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oldham (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clark, central Floyd, southwestern Oldham and northern Jefferson Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Albany, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds between 40 and 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... New Albany around 230 PM EDT. Louisville and Jeffersonville around 235 PM EDT. St. Matthews, Hurstbourne, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, Beechwood Village, Northfield, Woodlawn Park, Bellemeade, Rolling Fields and Glenview around 240 PM EDT. Lyndon, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Prospect, Anchorage, Worthington Hills, Barbourmeade, Coldstream, Rolling Hills and Langdon Place around 245 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
